summary: This document is email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial regarding stipulations to the authenticity of evidence, specifically depositions of individuals identified as CA, DA, and GM. The emails discuss procedural matters and deadlines ahead of a court conference.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell corresponding with prosecutors about stipulating to the authenticity of evidence, including depositions.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial stipulations.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial stipulations.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial stipulations.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the Ghislaine Maxwell trial; prosecutors plan to raise the stipulation issue with her.

persons.name: Lara E. Pomerantz
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, involved in sending proposed stipulations and the verdict form to the defense.

connections.description: Colleagues on Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, copied together on correspondence.

events.title: Planned Conference with Judge Nathan
events.description: Prosecutors plan to raise the issue of stipulating to the authenticity of certain documents (birth certificates and a statement) with Judge Nathan.

events.title: Defense Agrees to Stipulate to Depositions
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell informs prosecutors they are prepared to stipulate to the authenticity of three depositions (CA, DA, and GM).

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The defense agreed to stipulate to the authenticity of three key depositions identified as CA, DA, and GM for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
The defense was not immediately prepared to stipulate to the authenticity of birth certificates and a statement, needing more time to consider the issue.
The correspondence shows ongoing pre-trial negotiations between the prosecution and defense over evidence authentication to streamline the trial process.
The emails reference attached deposition files: GX_1007 (ICA_depo), GX_1008 (GM_depo), and GX_1006 (DA_depo), indicating these are significant exhibits.
